title: Strictly: Will Bayley forced to quit after horrific leg injury
text:
Will Bayley has been forced into an early exit on Strictly after landing awkwardly on his knee in rehearsals (Picture: BBC)

Will Bayley has been forced to quit Strictly Come Dancing after a horrific leg injury in rehearsals left him unable to perform.

The Paralympian admitted he was ‘gutted’ to pull out, after he was given a bye through to next week’s competition after jumping off a table and collapsing on his knee.

Viewers saw brief footage of the star coiled over in pain to explain his absence, with his future on the show in doubt.

That was confirmed tonight he would not be returning as Strictly tweeted the sad news along with a statement.

‘Sadly Will Bayley is leaving #Strictly,’ the message read. ‘@WillBayleytt and @JManrara will join @ZoeTheBall on tonight’s #ItTakesTwo.’

The full statement from the BBC read: ‘Sadly, due to the injury sustained last week, Will Bayley is leaving Strictly Come Dancing.’

Executive Producer Sarah James said: ‘We are so sad that Will is unable to continue on the show. He is an incredible and talented person who has brought us some unforgettable moments this series – in particular his powerful and moving Couple’s Choice routine. He will be greatly missed and we wish him a speedy recovery.’

‘I’m gutted my Strictly journey has had to come to an end,’ Will said in the statement.

‘I’ve loved being part of the show, and am so grateful for the phenomenal support we have received. I want to say a special thank you to Janette for believing in me and giving me the confidence to believe in myself. The things we achieved, from our Couple’s Choice dance through to the lifts in our Salsa, will stay with me forever. I’ve had the time of my life.’

Will Bayley was unable to perform on Strictly Come Dancing over the weekend (Picture: BBC)

Will’s partner Janette Manrara added: ‘Absolutely devastated that Will and I will not be able to continue dancing. We made some incredible memories that I will never forget, and I am pleased to have shared them with such an inspirational person, whom I can now call a friend for life.’

It Takes Two host Zoe Ball sent her love to the champ, as she tweeted: ‘All the love to @WillBayleytt & @JManrara,’ along with two love hearts.

Her co-host Rylan Clark-Neal chimed in: ‘Soooo gutted for @WillBayleytt you’re amazing mate and so sad you’ve had to leave. Wishing you a speedy recovery. And to lovely @JManrara you’re simply amazing! Xxx We’re gonna miss you xxxx.’

Appearing on the show tonight, he insisted his disability wasn’t to blame for his injury.

He said: ‘I just want people to know that it’s not because I have a disability, I don’t want people to be put off dancing, it can happen to anyone, it’s just unlucky.’

His fellow contestants and other pros soon took to social media to share their heartbreak at Will’s departure.

Will was heavily praised as an inspiration during his time on the show as he performed alongside Janette.

The table tennis champion has arthrogryposis, a rare condition which affects all four of his limbs, causing curved and/or stiff joints and muscle weakness.

His final dance, a contemporary routine to ballad Seven Years, left Motsi Mabuse and half the cast in tears as it told the story of his cancer survival and condition.

Will is the second person this year to leave the competition due to injury, with Made In Chelsea’s Jamie Laing ending up in a moon boot and on crutches after the first group dance performance.

Kelvin Fletcher was drafted in to replace Jamie alongside Oti Mabuse as a jump up from the floor ripped tendons in the reality star’s foot.

On last night’s show, professional dancer Neil Jones was also ruled out of the show due to injury, forcing Kevin Clifton to jump in with an hour’s notice to dance in his place alongside Alex Scott.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 7pm on BBC One.
